SENT.plain: To improve the efficacy of local intraarterial fibrinolysis (LIF), we compared different fibrinolytic drugs in a cerebral circulation model in the laboratory
The technical efficacy of fibrinolysis, defined as the clot volume lysed per unit time, was found to be optimal with r-tissue plasminogen activator (TPA) activated lys-plasminogen (= plasmin)
Subsequently, 20 patients with stroke due to carotid artery territory occlusion were treated by local intraarterial fibrinolysis using the plasmin regimen
The angiographic data and clinical outcome of these patients were compared with those of 40 patients who received plasminogen activators (urokinase or r-TPA) only
Laboratory and clinical data confirmed that plasmin lysis is superior to treatment using only plasminogen activators
